description: Creates a log stream for the specified log group.
mitreAttackSubTechniques: T1562.001 Impair Defenses: Disable or Modify Tools

unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: Attackers might leverage valid cloud accounts to create log streams, maintaining persistent access and monitoring activities without raising suspicion.
Creating log streams with names that mimic legitimate applications or services helps attackers blend in with normal operations and evade detection.
Log streams can be used to automate the collection of log data from various sources within the cloud environment, aiding attackers in data aggregation.
Log streams can be used to systematically archive collected data, which can later be accessed or exfiltrated.
Attackers use valid accounts to create and manage log streams as part of a strategy to maintain persistence and monitor activities without raising suspicion
Using log streams to stage data before it is exfiltrated, organizing it for easy access and transfer.
Collecting data from local systems and logging it into cloud log streams for analysis helps in understanding the local system's behavior and activities.

incidents.description: Cloud Security Stories: From Risky Permissions to Ransomware Execution

securityImplications: Attackers might use CreateLogStream to later add benign log entries, effectively burying any signs of his malicious activities.
